intro: Lopezia clavata, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Lopezia clavata has small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Its adaptive features, such as succulent leaves and deep root systems, enable it to survive in harsh desert conditions.
